question: Which of the following refers to Vajapeya?
option1: It means unquestioned control over an area in which the royal horse ran uninterrupted
option2: It is a royal consecration and conferred supreme power on the king
option3: It was a chariot race in which royal chariot was made to win against all kinsmen
explanation: Various kind of rituals strengthened the power of the King during the later vedic times. Vajapeya literally means drink of strength. The ritual consisted of a chariot race in which royal chariot was made to win against all kinsmen.
